conclusion: Need to calculate the change in magnetic flux as coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
Magnetic flux is given by the product of magnetic induction intensity and area of the coil.
The coil ABCO is a rectangle with points A, B, C, and O.
Calculate length l using distance formula: l = 0.707 m.
Calculate width w using distance formula: w = 0.866 m.
Area of coil ABCO is A = 0.707 x 0.866 = 0.614 m².
Calculate magnetic flux Φ = B x A = 0.1 T x 0.614 m² = 0.0614 Wb.
Change in magnetic flux as coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis is 0.0614 Wb.
